column1: The land of '''Nevrast''' lay on the coast of the [[Belegaer
column2: Great Sea]] in [[Middle-earth]]. The name meant ''Hither Shore'' in [[Sindarin]], as opposed to the ''Distant Shore'' of [[Aman]] and was originally applied to all the shores of [[Beleriand]] (although Nevrast was usually not included in [[West Beleriand]]).

column1: However, Nevrast was sheltered by mountains that separated it from [[Hithlum]], so its weather was more like Beleriand that the lands to the northeast.  It received ample rains from the sea which drained into the great mere of [[Linaewen]] in the midst of the land, for Nevrast was enclosed by mountains with no outward flowing rivers.<ref name="Bel">{{S

Nevrast was the first part of Beleriand the [[Noldor]] settled, but it had been previously inhabited by [[Sindar]]. Nevrast's population was soon very mixed, far more so than any other region of Beleriand.
Nevrast was the centre of an [[Elves
column2: Elven]] kingdom of [[Turgon]] for about a century until ca. {{FA
column3: 116}}, when the people began their trek to [[Gondolin]].<ref>{{S
column4: Noldor}}</ref> Turgon's capital (and it seems the only city of Nevrast) was [[Vinyamar]].<ref name="Bel"/> The land was not permanently inhabited after that, and indeed was utterly abandoned until [[Tuor]] came there, guided by [[Ulmo]].<ref>{{S
